results.content:
Jazeb has done a good job with this course but it needs updating to use a later version of Bootstrap as half of the things in Bootstrap 3 do not work in Bootsrap 4. I found this very frustrating to try and find a solution rather than actually learning what is being taught.

He could also update the couse with the new version of PHP making it easier for people to install XAMPP without having to did around for a specific version. 

He could also update to use MySQLi instead of using the older MySQL. I had not problem converting his MySQL code to the newer MySQLi code though.

I could not get the email part to work properly as instructed in this course but was able to achieve the correct results when it was done on a hosted web server. This might also trip up a few people.

Jazeb is very thourough with his explanations of what he is doing and how to achieve it but do we really need, as an example, explanation of all 7 pagination tabs and what they do.

If you are new to PHP, MySQL I found it informative course and learnt alot.
It was the Bootstrap part for me let this course down as not that easy to get an older version of Bootstrap or work out how to use Bootstrap 4 to achive a similar result.

Would I recommend this course, yes I would but with the caveats I have mentioned above.

results.content:
This is probably the worst PHP MySQL course available on Udemy. Total waste of time and money. Tech stack is deprecated and the course should either be free or removed from Udemy all together.
The instructor is arrogant and really talks down on students asking for help in the Q&A.
He might know PhP programming, but his actual code is really way off standard. 
Styles get added randomly in the head section of various pages, a hell of a lot of code is written repetitively, the main project has no clear structure or architecture and I can literally carry on about all the frustrations in this course.
The only good reason to actually do this course is if you want a really good refactoring challenge and whatever you do, DON'T ask for help on Stackoverflow where you have to share your code for others to see. You will be ripped to shreds rather than get any help because the code is just so terrible and begging for SQL injections.
As I said before, if you want to waste a LOT of time and have some spare change around, knock yourself out. I for one will steer WAY clear of ANYTHING that is produced by Jazeb Akram.
Easily the worst experience on Udemy - I actually enjoy all my other courses on Udemy and it is my hobby to work through projects. 
I will complete this, but only because I hate leaving things half done. 
Jazeb Akram is also "awarding" free access to one of his other courses to students who are willing to upload their complete projects (done in PhP7 and MySQLi) to his drop box. I won't be doing this, as hopefully after completing this, it will be the last I ever hear of the worst tutor I have ever come across.

results.content:
I only made it about 30% into the course, but I couldn't continue. The content I feel is valuable, but there are many coding standards being ignored, and I feel this course could actually teach bad habits. 

Code indenting / spacing is a huge problem in this course, and makes the code extremely confusing to read. if / else blocks are almost unreadable because of the random indenting of some lines and not others. Some blocks have the content with no indenting but have the if / else lines indented (basically the exact opposite of how it should be), and some have all the lines with no indenting at all. Everything is just run together.. Even variable assignment is consistently written like $a=2 instead of $a = 2. Uppercase / Lowercase with variables and functions is also basically random. Being consistent in spacing, indenting and casing of variable and function names is really important.

This might seem trivial, and maybe I'm being OCD, but if shortcuts like this are taken with simple things like indenting, what other things are being skipped.. I'm just going to find some tutorials on YouTube for Codeigniter and some other popular PHP frameworks, and learn from there.

Code indenting / spacing is a huge problem in this course, and makes the code extremely confusing to read. if / else blocks are almost unreadable because of the random indenting of some lines and not others. Some blocks have the content with no indenting but have the if / else lines indented (basically the exact opposite of how it should be), and some have all the lines with no indenting at all. Everything is just run together.. Even variable assignment is consistently written like $a=2 instead of $a = 2. Uppercase / Lowercase with variables and functions is also basically random. Being consistent in spacing, indenting and casing of variable and function names is really important.

This might seem trivial, and maybe I'm being OCD, but if shortcuts like this are taken with simple things like indenting, what other things are being skipped.. I'm just going to find some tutorials on YouTube for Codeigniter and some other popular PHP frameworks, and learn from there.

results.content: Course started out great until it got to db implementation.  Real world scenario is no hosted services use mysql anymore and only support mysqli at the least.  There is one small section addressing a small portion of this but I ended up re-engineering all lectures from db implementation on to get them to work on my localhost as well as hosted servers.  Contacted him and was told to look at section 133 which is almost 70 lectures later to see that even the implementation of mysqli briefly addressed isn't advised and best practices should be using PDO, this never gets addressed at any point prior that I can see, so essentially the course is about something you shouldn't even be doing.  I am more than a lot disappointed.  Feels like this course should be updated to what people should really be doing or just removed as it didn't help me get the actual knowledge needed.  I can't recommend this course.
